title: What songs are good to choose to audition for YG entertainment if I want to be a rapper (English or Korean but not songs with the n-word)? - Quora

response.answer_text: There isn't really a song in Korean with the word 'naega', as it is how they say 'you' in informal language (banmal). You're especially narrowing that down to very few choices where you want a rap song. Rap songs are notorious for insulting people, therefore you can't get away with not saying 'you' at least once. Korean songs are no different. However, there are a few songs that I thought of when I read this question that I think are 'naega' free, or just about. There are also a few English raps that I think you could definitely pass with. Boys and Girls - Zico Better Now - Post Malone Dally - Hyolyn Blue Moon - Changmo ft. Hyolyn Let You Down - NF (pretty much anything by NF is amazing) Pro tip: DON'T AUDITION USING ANY OF BTS'S SONGS. Just don't do it. YG hates them, and will probably drop you like a hat because of that. Also avoid singing songs by anyone under his label, as it comes off as 'goody-goody'. And don't wear clothes with names of your biases on them. Just wear normal, casual clothes. Good luck, girl! Go get them <3

In my personal opinion,Song like Tell me you love me by demi lovato is a good option,you can just go for a vocal class for maybe two or three days to enhance your voice as that song is kinda trendy and emotional love song
